name: Arduino Ultrasonic Sensor With Red LED Alert
description: Arduino Nano detects objects using an HC-SR04 ultrasonic sensor and lights a red LED through a 220Ω resistor when an object is close.
connections: Arduino D13 → 220Ω Resistor → Red LED Anode (+)
Arduino powered using USB or 5V regulated supply
howItWorks: Arduino measures distance using ultrasonic pulses. If the detected distance is below the threshold, Arduino turns ON the red LED via a safe current-limiting resistor.
powerNotes: Arduino powers both sensor and LED (low current).
safetyNotes: Always use a resistor with LED.
Avoid powering Arduino with more than 12V if using VIN.
